instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This arrived with no liquid damage. Customer claims it just randomly stopped turning on.

Stuck at 5v. All AWAKE and SLP2R voltages are present and stable.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.35V

When plugging into other mac apple configurator 2 automatically goes in  DFU mode without pressing keyboard keys. Revive or restore instantly fail.

Anything else worth checking or just bad T2?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Did you check for liquid sign on audio board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: yes and there was no liquid

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Force off the target machine; pressing power button 4-5s.
Then try to put it in DFU mode in normal way.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: After pressing power button 5 seconds it will momentairly get out of DFU mode for 1 second or less then automatically goes back into DFU mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
